name: spinynorman
text:
It's weird - on the one hand you have germaphobes. But these same neurotic people are the ones worried about the supergerms because of all the antibacterial and antibiotics we use.

Fuckin' pick a side, people.

And for no reason, this reminds me of a friend who convinced his girl that condoms were antibacterial and thus contributing to the superbug, and she switched to pills and let him start rawdoggin' it.

Classic shithead.

name: bjorntd
text: This is a brilliant tactic.

name: heccibiggs
text: He ain't wearin' no gunny sack.

text: My girlfriend's older sister calls Coldstone "Stone Cold Steve Icecream" which cracks me up every time I think of it.

name: theseknives
text: Panel 5 is one of my favorite Achewood moments.

text: Any strip that ends with Lyle flipping the bird is an automatic 5.

name: joeyramoney
text: A comment left by joeyramoney was marked lame too many times and excluded. (marked lame by straw, divot, blastradius, Jesler729, Ariamaki, farqussus, shogun, aHatOfPig, Boyd, daftsquare, yingkaixing, excusemesenator, Mastronaut, morbo)

name: unfun
text: Yes, that is what the strip says, sort of.

name: rowboat
text:
Oh! Are you referring to that comic strip that I just looked at? Yeah! That was so funny when they said

Ray - "Alright, Lyle. Here's the prototype for the SaniTaco! single serving prep counter. Put your hands in these rubber gloves...unlatch the taco meat and put it on the tortilla. Push the finished taco closer to the wall (UNH)... Then just ask the customer to break the safety seal and take out their taco! Go on, you try it!"

Lyle - "Here's your taco. The doctors did everything they could. I'm...I'm so sorry."

Ray - "Man, don't act like the taco died! Come on, Lyle! Come on!"

Alt text: This cartoon makes an extremely important social comment and I expect to be having lunch with Boondocks by the end of the week.

name: zapatos
text: I like the part where Ray acts incredulously at Lyle's actions, because he really should have expected that.

name: rowboat
text: It was the best part. For some reason, the "UNH" really makes me happy, too. You just never know when something simple is just gonna sneak up and make you mysteriously glad.

name: zapatos
text: Like when you are sitting in a chair, reading a nice book and the doorbell rings.  You stand up to get all pissed off, but your girlfriend is standing there all sexied up.  Yeah.  That will never happen to me.

name: tekende
text: Your many other comments lead me to believe this likely happens to you at least four times a year.

name: rowboat
text: I think the important distinction to be draw from this is between "girlfriend" and "small army of animal-like sluts."

name: tekende
text:
Good point.

Also where can I find one of these small armies, I think it would come in handy

name: zapatos
text: Bars.  I write and read poetry, girls love it.

name: rowboat
text: OHHHHHHH SHIIIIIIIIIIIIT!

name: dougthehead
text: The one thing I never got about this strip- how come they don't close the taco?  Are they expecting the customer to eat it open-faced, or what?

text: Tacos are often served open-faced in areas which contain Mexicans who might eat them.
